intro: Commiphora lughensis, commonly known as the Lughensis myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves with a leathery texture. It produces a resinous sap that has been historically used for medicinal and aromatic purposes. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
